title: Context on Janna nerfs?
body: Has anyone seen any context on the nerfs Janna is currently getting on PBE to her shield's AD values? They don't matter all that much, but I've never seen anyone ever having a problem with the damage that it gives allies. I've also personally never believed that what it gave was extreme or worth a nerf.

replies.body:
The intent was to trim some of her less appreciated power because she's been overperforming lately.  

We had larger nerfs targeted at her ultimate with the purpose to reduce melee frustration.  We opted out of them because she isn't so strong that we wanted to tone down her highest moment of excitement and power.   Note: disable duration is still down on her ultimate, we had other changes that reduced the range of the knockback which were pulled.

I don't understand why you aren't targeting her low interaction passive, which drastically needs to be changed due to the invisible power it is offering. It's very frustrating to play against with absolute no effort on the Janna's part. I say this having thousands of games played as Janna since season 1. She has been nerfed so many times that she honestly feels like a shadow of her former self, especially if you choose to build her squishy/AP focused.

I find it amusing that Janna is being seen as "OP" and getting all these complaints from lower tier players simply because she counters the tanky assassin meta (not to mention the INSANE death timers). Poke supports hard counter her, but they're so drowned out by Alistar and Braum right now that you never see them. It might be worth addressing that first before you gut Janna's kit /again/.

I can only speak for myself but "my carry has a free BF Sword as long as my shield's on them" is quite possibly one of the best parts of Janna's late game IMO. It doesn't get utilized very well down here in Bronze, but even in early game I go E first with the specific purpose of making last-hitting easier for my carry. The shield part is icing on the cake to me, and that's not just because I have relatively slow reflexes and often don't get the shield on my carry until after they've taken the poke I was trying to block with it.

And this is beside the point, but just saying, if you care about melee frustration whatsoever, the absolute very first thing you need to do is delete Kalista from the game. THEN you can start worrying about the Jannas and Namis and other supports whose entire purpose in teamfights is ruining the melee's day.

Alistar's nerf is a complete joke and won't change anything ,and Braum got no nerf at all

Janna does not become overbearing to play against in an unhealthy way, nor does she have little to no counterplay. She is exceptionally powerful because of her ability to punish SoloQ mentalities (miscommunicated engages, bad coordination, covering for her own teammate's errors). It is also a plus that she has strong lane match-ups against most of the current meta supports.

This has ALWAYS been true, throughout all of Janna's history.

That said, Janna is something that definitely needs to exist in some form or another in the league of legends dynamic, if we are to value style diversity and strategic counterplay. To simply call it "overpowered" because it has a strong statistical showing in the cesspit of SoloQ, resulting in targeted nerfs that may affect her competitive relevancy, is detrimental as a whole to league of legends.

Obviously there is wiggle room here, and I'm not at all opposed to some nerfs here or there, but I think we approach a dangerous area when we simply label high win-rate SoloQ champions as inherently overpowered instead of examining WHY they are overpowered.

This attitude could lead to a barrage of unwarranted nerfs ( hi swain, hi karthus) and lack of appropriate nerfs for the biggest offenders of competitive variety. (hi Lucian, hi Corki, hi Braum)
Less appreciated power? If you want to hit her this way you could totally remove her AP ratio on Q and no one will say nothing.
Oh they'll be back; Riot never turns down an opportunity to destroy one of Janna's abilities.
Janna has been overperforming for a long time, so I would guess that the nerf was meant to address her strength while keeping her peeling and defensive power intact.
